text: The Great Cookbook of Grudges
Drunken Ogres
A Revolting Meal
A Delicious Meal
Fearful Gnoblars

After our Feast, our Dwarven Allies send a dessert with a message: they've written down our recipe and chronicled our feast in their people's greatest cook book. They won't forget our cullinary innovation any time soon. \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating allied Dwarf units[[col]]

After we Feast, our Ogres bellow and quarrel as they stumble around the camp. Their appetites are sated, but their skull pounds as the morning sun rises.  \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating allied Dwarf or Kislevite units[[col]]

After we feast, our Ogres can be heard grumbling. The meat was stringy, with more bone and gristle than flesh. Ogres will eat anything, but they'd rather not eat that.  \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating allied Peasant units[[col]]

After we feast, our Ogres rave at the flavour of the meat. When the next battle is joined, there will be no difficulties getting some of them to guard the flank.  \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating allied Cavalry units[[col]]

After our feast, Gnoblars have made themselves scarce. You're offering good pay and plenty of opportunity for promotion, but still the Gnoblars seem reticent to come anywhere near your camp.  \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating a lot of Gnoblars[[col]]
Aching Stomach
Aching Stomach
Aching Stomach
After our Feast, even the Ironguts are feeling a little queasy. Buboes and Pox are easy enough to eat, but much harder to stomach. \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating allied Nurgling units[[col]]

After our Feast, even the Ironguts are feeling a little queasy. Their stomaches churn as though their food still marched within their stomach. \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating allied Undead units[[col]]
After our Feast, even the Ironguts are feeling a little queasy. A pale green glow permeates their raucous belches. \\n[[col:yellow]]Gained from eating allied Skaven units[[col]]
Eat Units
This lot is getting hungry, and it looks to them like you've stocked meat for the occasion. Shall we let em have a snack, boss?
Eat Em Now!
Eat Em Later
There's good meat on them! Throw em in the pot!
We've still got a use for these ones. Let's go eat somethin else.
